ECB staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area (March 2017) https://t.co/j7IynuhpX6
Draghi: Regarding the outlook for inflation, we haven't seen any significant development on the wage front yet
Draghi: The euro is here to stay. It is irrevocable. A more productive question is how do we increase prosperity?
Draghi: The euro has been the pillar upon which the single market could prosper
Draghi: No member of the Governing Council felt the need to discuss a new TLTRO
Draghi: The balance of risk regarding growth has improved
Draghi: Lending rates for households and companies have decreased significantly
Draghi: Risks of deflation have largely disappeared
Draghi: The most equitable measure of all is to decrease unemployment
Draghi: Unemployment rate in January lowest since May 2009
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/OsAK0YmVx6
Draghi: Other policy areas must contribute much more decisively to strengthening economic growth
Draghi: Staff projections are conditional on the full implementation of all our monetary policy measures
Draghi: ECB staff projections: HICP at 1.7% in 2017 (1.3% in Dec proj), 1.6% in 2018 (1.5%), 1.7% in 2019 (unchanged)
Draghi: ECB staff projections: GDP increase by 1.8% in 2017 (1.7% in Dec proj), 1.7% in 2018 (1.6%) and 1.6% in 2019 (unchanged)
Draghi: If outlook becomes less favourable, we stand ready to increase our asset purchase programme in terms of size and/or duration
Draghi: Very substantial degree of accommodation still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation
Draghi: Headline inflation increased, mainly due to rising energy and food prices. However, underlying inflation pressures remain subdued.
Draghi: Our monetary policy measures continue to preserve very favourable financing conditions needed to reach inflation objective
Draghi: APP purchases to continue at a pace of €60 billion as of April until end of December 2017, or beyond, if necessary
Draghi: We continue to expect rates to remain at present or lower levels for extended period, and well past horizon of net asset purchases
